results.title: Baboon development: the older infant, four months to one year (Nairobi Park)
results.creator_credit: National Science Foundation, Ford Foundation, Educational Services and Quentin Brown
results.brief_description: Part of a series of films on the baboons of Kenya. Shows without commentary or narration, the growth and development of a baby baboon over one year of its life.

results.title: Babies need books
results.creator_credit: New Zealand Broadcasting Corporation and New Zealand Trade & Enterprise
results.brief_description: A mother, grandmother, teacher and children’s bookseller, Dorothy Butler believes that books should play a crucial role in children’s lives right from the first months. The film is an informative and entertaining introduction to 58 favourite children’s books.

results.title: Babies Are People Too (Captioned)
results.brief_description: An anti-child abuse film for young mothers to give them a better understanding of how their infants develop during the first two years and how behaviour is an expression of their infant’s needs. The objective is to make better mothers, and hence, better adjusted babies.

results.title: Babe [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Kennedy-Miller, George Miller, Doug Mitchell, Bill Miller and Chris Noonan
results.brief_description: This is the story of an unprejudiced heart and how it changed our valley forever. So begins “Babe”, the critically acclaimed, oscar-nominated film where the animals are the true stars. It is the tale of Hoggett’s farm where every creature has a purpose until the orphaned piglet Babe arrives and turns everything upside down. Cared for by Fly the sheepdog, he soon comes to think of himself as a dog. Farmer Hoggett senses something special in Babe and though everyone thinks he is crazy, enters him in the National Sheepdog Championships. This is a truly heartwarming tale about having faith in your abilities and being true to your heart.

results.title: Babar: The City of Elephants
results.creator_credit: Michael Hirsh, Patricia Loubert, Clive A Smith and Raymond Jafelice
results.brief_description: Babar Returns - Babar leaves the old lady and the city to return to the jungle so that he can bring the other elephants his newfound knowledge. But he finds that they resist trying any of his new ideas. “City of the Elephants” - As the elephants new king, Babar’s first decree is to build a city. However, he must contend with Lord Rataxes, who is also trying to build a city, as well as his own obsession to see his city completed on time. Rated: G

results.title: Babar. to Duet or Not to Duet; the Missing Crown Affair.
results.creator_credit: Belvama-Ellipse, Clifford Ross Co, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation, Michael Hirsh, Patrick Loubert, Clive A Smith and Laura Shepherd
results.brief_description: Two more animated versions of the Babar picture books. “To duet or not to duet”. The young Babar is scheduled to perform a duet with a great pianist at a concert, but he refuses to admit that the piece is too hard for him. “The missing crown affair” When Babar’s crown goes missing, Zephir decides to help solve the mystery. Could the stolen crown be the first step towards taking over Babar’s kingdom? Based on the picture books by Jean and Laurent de Brunhoff.
results.title_for_label: Babar. to Duet or Not to Duet; the Missing Crown Affair.

results.title: Babar. Story of Babar the little elephant. Babar comes to America.
results.creator_credit: Nelvana, Lee Mendelson, Bill Melendez and Ed Levitt
results.brief_description: Narrated by Peter Ustinov and based on the Brunhoff books about Babar the King of the Elephants. “Story of Babar the little elephant” introduces us to Babar. After his mother is shot by hunters he runs away to Paris where he is adopted by a kind little old lady. Although he loves her he misses the jungle and returns home where he is crowned King of the Elephants and marries his true love, Celeste. Based on “The Travels of Babar” and “Babar comes to America” episode two follows Babar and Celeste as they travel first by balloon, then whale and ship to America where they become movie stars.

results.title: Babar. School days; King Tuttle's vote
results.creator_credit: Nelvana, Ellipse, Michael Hirsh, Patrick Loubert, Clive A Smith and Laura Shepherd
results.brief_description: Two adventures of Babar the elephant. “School Days”. When Babar’s son Alexander is upset because “he wants to be like the other kids”, Babar tells him about his own time at school. The school bullies, Marcel and Maurice pick on his trunk but Babar has the last laugh. “King Tuttle’s vote” King Tuttle’s vote is needed to stop the Rataxes from polluting Lake Celestine. He is “kingnapped” by them, however Babar and his friends save both King Tuttle and the lake. Adapted from the stories of Jean and Laurent de Brunhoff.

results.title: Babar. Race to the Moon; No Place Like Home
results.creator_credit: Nelvana, Clifford Ross Co, Michael Hirsh, Patrick Loubert, Clive A Smith and Laura Shepherd
results.brief_description: More trouble with Lord Rataxes awaits King Babar in these two adventures in Elephant land: “Race to the Moon” - Babar’s hopes of rebuilding an old theatre are jeopardised when all his subjects get caught up in trying to build a rocket ship to beat Lord Rataxes to the moon. “No Place Like Home” - Babar lets a young circus boy live in the palace. But when the lad wants to return to his circus home, he discovers that it might be too late, because the circus has been captured by Lord Rataxes. Based on the picture books by Jean and Laurent de Brunhoff.

results.title: Babar. Elephant's best friend; The Show must go on
results.creator_credit: Nelvana, Ellipse, Michael Hirsh, Patrick Loubert, Clive A Smith and Laura Shepherd
results.brief_description: Join Babar in two more delightful episodes: 1. “An Elephant’s Best Friend” - Lord Rataxes stops all pomegranate shipments from reaching Celesteville, but when Babar calls on the help of a warthog, Rataxes is suddenly willing to talk. 2. “The Show Must Go On” - Babar organises a world-class ballet to be performed in Celesteville, but the star of the show, a temperamental prima ballerina, causes problems for cast and crew. Based on the books by Jean and Laurent de Brunhoff.
